intro: Lobelia spicata var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often used in native plant gardens.
